block.p: Nancy Sanson Walbridge and Ronald Alvin Collins were married yesterday at the Church at Point O'Woods on Fire Island. The Rev. Carter Via, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Collins, 27, is a candidate for a master's degree in art history from the University of London. In October, she is to begin studying for a doctorate in art history at the Courtauld Institute of Art in London. She graduated from Georgetown University. Until September she was the assistant to the board of trustees at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. She is the daughter of Katherine and Paul D. Sanson of West Hartford, Conn. Her father is a partner in Shipman & Goodwin, a law firm in Hartford. Her mother is the manager of the adult education division at the Capital Region Education Council in Hartford. The bride legally changed her name.
Nancy Sanson Walbridge and Ronald Alvin Collins were married yesterday at the Church at Point O'Woods on Fire Island. The Rev. Carter Via, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Collins, 27, is a candidate for a master's degree in art history from the University of London. In October, she is to begin studying for a doctorate in art history at the Courtauld Institute of Art in London. She graduated from Georgetown University. Until September she was the assistant to the board of trustees at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. She is the daughter of Katherine and Paul D. Sanson of West Hartford, Conn. Her father is a partner in Shipman & Goodwin, a law firm in Hartford. Her mother is the manager of the adult education division at the Capital Region Education Council in Hartford. The bride legally changed her name.

Mr. Collins, 29, is a vice president in the international unit of CVC Capital Partners, a management buyout company in London. He received bachelor's and master's degrees in management from Northwestern University. From 1994 to 1996 he was a Peace Corps volunteer in Chad. He is the son of Carol and Paul J. Collins of London. His father works in London and New York as a vice chairman for proprietary investments at Citigroup.
